page.title: 16WILMINGTON VILLAGE - GENERAL
page.content: The village of Wilmington lies to the south of Dartford and although often included in information on Dartford retains its identity and its rural nature. The village is surrounded on 3 sides by farmland, the urbanised area of Dartford forming the fourth. The Parish of Wilmington is one of the largest in the country. The history of Wilmington dates back to pre-Roman times, Neolithic flint tools have been found in the area. The area was also famous for its cherry orchards. The Wilmington Society concerns itself with the preservation of the village atmosphere. Its aim is to retain the land between Dartford and Swanley as an area keeping its agricultural viability and the green appearance of areas around settlements. It is for each of us to oppose urbanisation here.
